alert.note: Alert for Central Middlesex County; Northern Worcester; Northwest Middlesex County; Southeast Middlesex; Southern Worcester (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 09 at 6:54PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Worcester and central Middlesex Counties with heavy rainfall through 800 PM EDT... At 653 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Bolton, or near Marlborough, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Minor flooding. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor nuisance flooding of typically flood prone areas. Locations impacted include... Framingham, Marlborough, Shrewsbury, Lexington, Westford, Acton, Hudson, Westborough, Grafton, Concord, Sudbury, Northborough, Clinton, Bedford, Wayland, Groton, Maynard, Southborough, Littleton, and Lancaster. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: Get indoors when you hear thunder. Do not resume outdoor activities until at least 30 minutes after the storm has passed. Do not drive through flooded roads or underpasses. Avoid low lying areas near small streams. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. For your safety, go indoors or to your vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Central Middlesex County; Northern Worcester; Northwest Middlesex County; Southeast Middlesex; Southern Worcester
